posts.cooked:
Hi!

I recently logged in to my Signal account on a Punkt MP02 and as I had issues, I tried to switch straight back to my Pixel 9a.

Ever since I tried this, I have been unable to get into my Signal account whatsoever. I am getting the following three error messages:

  1. You’ve made too many attempts to register this number. Please try again in [time]

  2. Too many attempts - You’ve made too many incorrect Registration Lock PIN attempts. Please try again in a day.

  3. Reg lock!

It seems random as to which of these 3 that the app gives me at any time. I know that my PIN that I’m entering is correct because if I enter a wrong one, I get the second message as well as a ‘PIN incorrect’ message whereas otherwise I get either the second one only or one of the other two.

Does anyone have any advice for me?

Thank you!
Are you on the official client and stock OS, i.e. the operating system the phones come with at purchase?
I am on the official client and using GrapheneOS. I have been using Signal on GrapheneOS since May with no issues.
How far exactly did you get with the login process on the Punkt?
I was able to fully log in and had Signal fully functioning. The issues I had were with the phone itself, which is when I decided I’d switch back to my Pixel.
Was there a data transfer or backup restore involved? Did you manage to start the transfer process on the new device or are you trying to register from scratch?

This sounds exactly like the problem I’ve been experiencing many times when switching devices. My most important advice is to stop logging on immediately as every time you try to log on, it resets the clock. Basically what’s happening in the background is that Signal put a security lock on your account. This can be (from my experience) 24 hours, 48 hours or (in my current case) 6 days. Every time you try to log on before the expiry of this timer, it restarts the clock. So if you want to be 100% certain you could wait 6 days or alternatively, start with 24 hours..

Yes, that is probably true. You should also be careful not to attempt registration without your PIN, since after a couple days the account will be reset and all your data will be lost.

You could try this timezone suggestion here:

https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007059792-Signal-PIN#pin_forgot

Thank you for the reply. I think I’m going to leave it alone until Saturday morning (after which it will have been 7.5 days since I encountered any problems) and if that doesn’t work, I’ll give it another week.

Out of curiosity, are you getting the same 3 error messages that I’m getting? Is one of them reg lock? Also, how do you know how long the security locks are?

Thank you!
How frustrating! I wish Signal were more clear on what actually the issue is here. How do you know the lengths of your security locks?

Yes, infuriating. It actually pushed me back to iOS, which is not ideal to say the least.

What I did to have a clear timeline was to then try to register on an iOS device where I received a very clear message and instructions about what is going on and the length. I then re-registered on iOS (which clears the entire message history on the iOS device only), waited 48 hours and re-registered on Android.

This worked with no problems but as I am also experiencing other problems (see the two threads I started on those), I have switched back to iOS and am currently locked out again. Once that reg lock expires on Saturday night, I will remain with iOS for the foreseeable future as Signal on Android is just causing way too many issues for me..

Wow. I’ve just tried to log in on an iPhone to test it out, and I’ve been told to wait 24 hours after the login failed!

What a mess this is…
I have nothing to retrieve on the old Signal account either, so I wish there was an option to delete everything and reset it immediately so I can make a new account again!

It really is a mess. And I don’t understand why there is such a huge difference between Android and iOS. Of course, iOS usually gets more love from devs due to the significantly higher revenue potential. That said, I would argue that Signal as an integral privacy app is much more important to the Android community.

Yep. Even stranger is the fact that Android has features that iOS doesn’t have such as a full backup system. (I might be making that up completely but I’m sure I’ve heard it somewhere.)

In any case, I will forward all of this to Signal once I’ve got a solution and ask them to have a look at some of the issues mentioned, particularly the discrepancy of info between the Android and iOS apps.

Thank you very much for your help in this thread! I’m sure I’ll get this solved one day.
Please let me know if you get a reply. I submitted loads of debug logs but never got a reply.

I attempted to log in on an iPhone a few days ago yesterday with my PIN (which I know) and I was asked to wait 24 hours after the login inexplicably failed.

After those 24 hours were up, I tried without my pin and I got the following message:

image640×1136 74.5 KB

I decided to wait these 10 hours to try something new because I had nothing on my Signal account that needed saving (I’ve got disappearing messages enabled on my chats, etc.) and after these 10 hours were up, I was finally able to log back into Signal. I then deleted my account on the iPhone and on my main phone, I changed the number on the Signal account that I was using temporarily to my main number and finally this has been solved.

I have no idea what the problem was or why it took this long to be solved, but I thought I’d post this update for anyone who may stumble across this in the future.

Thank you @klasmeister for your help. I would not have been able to solve this as quickly as I did without the information that the login screen is far more informative on iPhones!

I’ll forward this whole thread to Signal, and I’m hoping that they’ll take some notice of the various issues that came up in this entire process.

Edit: Looks like I can’t send DMs..

I’m very please that you were able to solve the issue. Will send you a DM so you can include my email address and Signal username in your message to Signal?
